sen.j: 久我 通兄（こが みちえ、宝永6年11月4日 (旧暦)（1709年12月4日） - 宝暦11年5月19日 (旧暦)（1761年6月21日））は、江戸時代中期の公卿。
sen.e: Michie KOGA (December 4, 1709 - June 21, 1761) was a Kugyo (court noble) in the middle of the Edo period.
Michie KOGA (December 4, 1709 - June 21, 1761) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the middle of the Edo period.
Michie KOGA (December 4, 1709 - June 21, 1761) was a Kugyo (court noble) during the middle of the Edo period.

sen.j: おもに中御門天皇（114代）・桜町天皇（115代）・桃園天皇（116代）の三帝にわたって仕え、官位は従一位右大臣まで昇った。
sen.e: He mainly served three emperors of the Emperor Nakamikado (114th), the Emperor Sakuramachi (115th), the Emperor Momozono (116th) and his official rank was raised to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, Minister of the Right.)

He mainly served during the reign of three emperors, Emperor Nakamikado (114th), Emperor Sakuramachi (115th), Emperor Momozono (116th) and his official rank was raised to Juichii Udaijin (Junior 1st Rank, Minister of the Right.)

He mainly served during the reign of three emperors, Emperor Nakamikado (114th), Emperor Sakuramachi (115th), Emperor Momozono (116th) and his official rank was raised to Juichii Udaijin (Junior First Rank, Minister of the Right.)
His father was Udaijin (Minister of the Right) Koremichi KOGA.
His father was Udaijin (Minister of the Right) Koremichi KOGA.
His father was Udaijin (Minister of the Right) Koremichi KOGA.

sen.j: 母は左近衛少将細川綱利（熊本藩主）の養女（細川利重（熊本新田藩主）の娘）。
sen.e: His mother was a adopted daughter of Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA (the lord of the Kumamoto domain) (a daughter of Toshishige HOSOKAWA (the lord of the Kumamoto Shinden domain.))

His mother was the adopted daughter of Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA (the lord of the Kumamoto domain) (a daughter of Toshishige HOSOKAWA - the lord of the Kumamoto Shinden domain.))

His mother was the adopted daughter of Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Tsunatoshi HOSOKAWA (the lord of the Kumamoto Domain) (a daughter of Toshishige HOSOKAWA - the lord of the Kumamoto Shinden Domain)).
sen.cmt: 用語統一ピリオド位置移動

sen.j: 息子に権大納言久我敏通・左近衛少将中院通維・権中納言東久世通積がいる。
sen.e: His sons were Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Toshimichi KOGA, Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Michikore NAKANOIN, Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) Michitsumu HIGASHIKUZE.

His sons were Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Toshimichi KOGA, Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Michikore NAKANOIN, Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) Michitsumu HIGASHIKUZE.

His sons were Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) Toshimichi KOGA, Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Michikore NAKANOIN, Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state) Michitsumu HIGASHIKUZE.

sen.j: 娘に左近衛権少将細川重賢（熊本藩主）の室、権大納言千種有政の室、修理大夫酒井忠貫（小浜藩主）の室がいる。
sen.e: His daughters were Sakone gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Shigekata HOSOKAWA's (the lord of the Kumamoto domain) wife, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Arimasa CHIGUSA's wife, Shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs) Tadatsura SAKAI's (the lord of the Obama domain) wife.

His daughters were Sakone gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Shigekata HOSOKAWA's (the lord of the Kumamoto domain) wife, Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) Arimasa CHIGUSA's wife, Shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs) Tadatsura SAKAI's (the lord of the Obama domain) wife.

His daughters were Sakone gon no shosho (Provisional Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards) Shigekata HOSOKAWA's (the lord of the Kumamoto Domain) wife, Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) Arimasa CHIGUSA's wife, Shuri no daibu (Master of the Office of Palace Repairs) Tadatsura SAKAI's (the lord of the Obama Domain) wife.

sen.j: 享保3年（1718年）叙爵して以降清華家当主として速いスピードで昇進した。
sen.e: In 1718 he was raised to the peerage and thereafter he was rapidly promoted as the head of the Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families in Japan at that time.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1718 he was raised to peerage and thereafter he was rapidly promoted as the head of the Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families in Japan at that time.)
In 1718 he was raised to peerage and thereafter he was rapidly promoted as the head of the Seiga family (one of the highest court noble families in Japan at that time).

sen.j: 侍従・左近衛中将を経て、享保9年（1724年）には従三位となり公卿に列する。
sen.e: After he served as Jiju (Chamberlain), Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and in 1724 he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and ranked as Kugyo (court noble.)
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After he served as Jiju (Chamberlain), Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and in 1724 he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and ranked as Kugyo (court noble.)

After he served as Jiju (Chamberlain), Sakone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), and in 1724 he became Jusanmi (Junior Third Rank) and ranked as Kugyo (court noble).

sen.j: 権中納言を経て、享保16年（1731年）権大納言、享保17年（1732年）踏歌節会外弁となる。
sen.e: After he served as Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state), in 1731 he became Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) and in 1732 he became Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie (Imperial Court Ceremony.))

After he served as Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state), in 1731 he became Gon Dainagon (provisional major counselor) and in 1732 he became Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie - Imperial Court Ceremonies.)

After he served as Gon Chunagon (provisional vice-councilor of state), in 1731 he became Gon Dainagon (provisional chief councilor of state) and in 1732 he became Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie - Imperial Court Ceremonies).
sen.cmt: ピリオド位置移動用語統一

sen.j: 寛保元年（1741年）武家伝奏に就任。
sen.e: In 1741 he assumed the office of buke tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the military government.)
In 1741 he assumed the office of buke tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the military government.)
In 1741 he assumed the office of buke tenso (liaison officers between the imperial court and the military government).

sen.j: 寛延3年（1750年）に武家伝奏を辞職し、右近衛大将・右馬寮御監に転じた。
sen.e: In 1750 he resigned as buke tenso and transferred to Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses.)
In 1750 he resigned as buke tenso and transferred to Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses.)
In 1750 he resigned as buke tenso and transferred to Ukone no daisho (Major Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Umaryo gogen (Inspector of the Right Division of Bureau of Horses).

sen.j: さらに同年のうちに内大臣に任じられている。
sen.e: In addition, the same year, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the center.)
In addition, the same year, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the center.)
In addition, the same year, he was appointed to Naidaijin (minister of the center).

sen.j: 宝暦4年（1754年）には従一位となり、さらに右大臣へと進む。
sen.e: In 1754 he became Juichii (Junior First Rank), then he was promoted to Udaijin (Minister of the Right.)
In 1754 he became Juichii (Junior First Rank), then he was promoted to Udaijin (Minister of the Right.)
In 1754 he became Juichii (Junior First Rank), then he was promoted to Udaijin (Minister of the Right).

sen.j: しかし翌年には辞職した。
sen.e: However, the following year, he resigned his post.
However, the following year, he resigned his post.
However, the following year, he resigned his post.

sen.j: 子の久我敏通とともに徳大寺家お抱えの学者竹内式部に入門し垂加神道や尊王論を学んだ。
sen.e: He and his child Toshimichi KOGA became a disciple of Shikibu TAKENOUCHI who was a scholar in ordinary to the Tokudaiji family and they learned Suika Shinto and imperialism.
He and his child Toshimichi KOGA became disciples of Shikibu TAKENOUCHI, a scholar to the Tokudaiji family and they learned Suika Shinto and imperialism.
He and his child Toshimichi KOGA became disciples of Shikibu TAKENOUCHI, a scholar to the Tokudaiji family and they learned Suika Shinto and imperialism.
